boardgame.name: Fish and Ships
boardgame.description:
Fish n’ Ships is a multiplayer card game about marine conservation: fish in a sustainable way in your sea in order to obtain more points than the other players for cards in the sea and cards of caught species.
The game reproduces the Adriatic and Mediterranean marine food web and fisheries complexity.
There are 36 different species divided into 4 groups based on their position in the food chain (Trophic level): producers (green cards), primary consumers (yellow cards), secondary consumers (orange cards) , tertiary consumers (red cards).
In the first phase of the game the players have to “build” their marine ecosystem, in which there must be organisms from all trophic levels.
A player with a healthy sea (i.e. with at least one red card) can start the second phase of the game: use the fishing cards to fish in the player’s own sea.
Every player starts having eight fishing cards, each one corresponding to a fishing technique commonly used in Adriatic Sea, with their target species and secondary effects on habitat.
There are other cards related to human activities or natural events that may affect the game (bonus, malus).
Points are assigned based on the healthy status of the player’s sea and on how he fished in a sustainable way.

The game is part of the Interreg project FAIRSEA (Fisheries in the AdriatIc Region - a Shared Ecosystem Approach), which objective is to enhance the conditions for implementing innovative approaches in the sector of sustainable fisheries management in the Adriatic Sea.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: KYNG Pirate Dice
boardgame.description:
Our take on the classic South American game; Peruvian Lying Dice.

1-X players.

Roll your own dice but keep them hidden from other players as you take turns making bets on everyone’s dice.

Get caught in a lie and you lose a die!

When you’re done to your last die, special rules kick in to help you make a comeback.

Lose your last die and you’re out.

Last player left in the game is the winner!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: La Taja
boardgame.description:
A night in a bar with friends. Your objective is to get drunk (catch "La Taja") before the rest of the players, adding and subtracting "taja" points. The taja points needed to win varies depending on the amount of players.

Set collection card game with Drink cards to get taja points, refreshment cards to reduce your oponent taja points and action cards to interact between players.

In his turn each player can draw a card from deck, play a card, discard a card or pass. Respecting the following rules:

Alcohol control: If you end your turn with more than 5 cards in hand, your opponents will randomly send cards from your hand to the Graveyard until you have 4.

Progressive taja: To be able to play a 2 point drink from your hand, you must have a 1 point drink on the table; and to play one of 3 have some of 2.

boardgame.name: Renda Passiva
boardgame.description:
In Renda Passiva ("Passive Income"), you assume the identity of characters with different financial situations, but all complicated. With the help of a Financial Statement, which represents the financial management of the character, players must seek the best investment strategies to overcome debts and achieve a flow of Passive Income greater than their total expenses.

Without a mandatory path on the board, the strategy chosen throughout the game is the great differentiator for earning Passive Income more quickly and safely.

boardgame.name: Közlekedj biztonságosan!
boardgame.description: The game draws attention to the facts, that for your safety on the streets, you need to be patient, advised, attentive and make the right decisions.

boardgame.name: A.E.G.I.S. Combining Robots: Season 2
boardgame.description:
AEGIS Combining Robots returns with an entirely new box of robots and heroes vying for control of Sigaea in all-out robot fighting tournament!

Choose a Commander, take their team of five robots into combat, and combine them into more powerful forms to defeat your opponents. Choose from dozens of robots and several game modes and duke it out up to six players! A match takes about 15 minutes per player.

This all-new box features:

Dozens of new robots, streamlined for easier learning and more tactical depth!
A roster of new Commanders, featuring new luck-mitigating mechanics!
Many exciting new combat and combining abilities!
New game mode! Play with respawning robots and rack up points!
Three boards! Play classic AEGIS, or get to punching faster on the Duel Boards!


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Knight Fall in Old Curgantium (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Doom Arises!

The glorious capital city of legendary Hyperborea fell to ruin two thousand years ago in a fiery night of destruction that burned half a continent and heralded the end of an ageless empire. New auguries brought a fellowship of valiant knights to the scorched ruins seeking an ancient danger that threatened the world anew, but those champions themselves disappeared among the broken stones of the shattered city. Now new heroes must take up their mantle, whether to rescue or avenge them, and by all means to complete the their desperate mission to forestall a new cataclysm. However, those daring to tread the ancient streets quickly discover that the ruins do not rest easy, and ancient memories can be as deadly as new perils in Old Curgantium.

Knight Fall in Old Curgantium is a D+D 5E adventure for 15th-level characters set in the fabled ruins of the ancient Hyperborean capital of Curgantium in the Lost Lands Campaign Setting. This rich and exciting world 20 years in the making has been home to dozens of adventures from Necromancer Games and Frog God Games and produced with their cooperation to be compatible with The World of the Lost Lands campaign guide! It is the fifth of six adventures in the Aegis of Empires Adventure Path, with each adventure exploring hitherto unexplored areas of the Lost Lands with a combination of horror, intrigue, deadly danger, and the lure of ancient mysteries.

boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

boardgame.name: KeyForge: Call of the Archons – Playmat
boardgame.description: This playmat was given as a prize in Open play events.

boardgame.name: Tower to the Abyss
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

Players take on the roll of adventurers hired by the nearby village to investigate the recent disapearances and monster sightings around the nearby military outpost. Reckless magical research has thrown Kalem's Tower into chaos as demons and devils pour out from the abyss. Players must use their wits, their skills, and every magical item at their disposal to survive the tower and close the portal to the chaotic hellscape.

For 3 - 5 players. Levels 3 - 8.

Includes 17 battle maps (both with and without grid), 4 DM maps, 7 new enemies, 9 new magical items, all in a completely new setting with bits of history sprinkled in as you go.

boardgame.name: Spielkartenset Flusslande
boardgame.description:
Dieses Set enthält alle Zaubertricks, Zaubersprüche, Rituale, Liturgien, Zeremonien, Sonderfertigkeiten, Wesenszüge, Kreaturen, Ausrüstungsgegenstände
und weitere nützliche Inhalte aus der Regionalspielhilfe Die Flusslande, der Rüstkammer der Region und des Abenteuers Ketten für die Ewigkeit. Auf den Karten befinden sich alle relevanten Informationen, sodass man sie als Meister direkt im Spiel nutzen kann.

boardgame.name: KeyForge: Call of the Archons – Chain Tracker Alternate Art Card
boardgame.description:
These cards were given as a prize in Open play events and for participating in Store championships.
The can be used instead of the one provided in the base boxes

boardgame.name: KeyForge: Call of the Archons – Power Tokens
boardgame.description:
A set of 5 plastic power tokens.
1 set was given as a prize for placing Top 4 in store championships.

boardgame.name: KeyForge: Call of the Archons – Sleeves
boardgame.description:
1 set was given as a prize for placing first in store championships.
50 sleeves per pack.

boardgame.name: Astral Horizon (2021 Update)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

2021 Update Of This Product Originally Released In 2018. Includes all new updated maps, more accurate scaling and descriptions, new art, and several new expanded sections.

Designed for First Class adventure by renowned starship engineer Dylan Winslett, the Astral Horizon is a cutting edge executive luxury liner based out of the Hardt Space Station in the Tanoos System.

The Astral Horizon is a pre-generated starship with deck plans for use with DWD Studios’ Frontier Space Role-playing game. This game supplement will provide you with a ready to use starship resource perfect for individual games or epic campaigns.

boardgame.name: Fear Eaters
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

What terrors we shall introduce in the new line known as Unspeakable Things! Vile monsters, horrible foes, disgusting abominations, THINGS THAT SHOULD NOT BE!!!! And yet. AND YET, here we are, with a new a terrible thing known as the fear eater, the foul Phantasmagor. Armed with this diabolic beast, you can subject your players to fears of their own imagining, to harrass them with their worst terrors. You might waver. You might delay. But you know you want this new unspeakable thing. Grab it today. Or else.

boardgame.name: Jaipur: Metal Seal of Excellence
boardgame.description: Three Seal of Excellence in metal, that can replace the originals, distributed by the publisher.

boardgame.name: TinyZine (Issue 31)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The thirty-first issue of TinyZine, the Gallant Knight Games e-zine is here! New bits for Gallant Knight Games in a small, fun, and affordable package!

Featuring:

Letter from the Editor: Alan Bahr
The Church of Dracaena, an undead cult that serves as excellent enemies in your TinyD6 games by Steffie de Vaan.
Dogfighting for Tiny Frontiers: Revised by James M. Spahn!
Beasts Beyond 2 by Colin Chapman
Fatal Eros, a Tiny Frontiers: Revised adventure by Jonathan Hicks!

boardgame.name: TinyZine (Issue 32)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Issue 32 of Gallant Knight Games' house e-zine is here! Featuring the following columns:

Fan favorite columnist Steffie de Vaan delivers Monster Kin: new Heritages based on monsters and their children!
Gregory Israel (the author of the excellent Beyond Sun and Shadow) provides a new Panic Mechanic for Tiny Living Dead!
Our ever-regular and esteemed Colin Chapman continues the excellent work found in last months’ Beasts Beyond, with the third iteration of his column!
And finally, James M. Spahn brings us The Beast That Gobbles, an adventure for Tiny Wastelands

boardgame.name: As Good As It Gets
boardgame.description:
As Good As It Gets is a card game created to be the perfect ice-breaker and general get-to-know-you party game for family and friends.

The game is simple. Each player will compete to win points by enticing the judge to pick their good scenario.

But there’s a catch! Each player will also try to sabotage another player’s chances of being picked by the judge by giving each other’s good scenario a bad catch.

The judge must choose which scenario (including the catch!) they would rather most have happen to them.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Caverna: Cave vs Cave – The Big Box
Caverna: Höhle gegen Höhle – The Big Box
boardgame.description:
In the two-player game Caverna: Cave vs. Cave, each player starts the game with only two dwarves and a small excavation in the side of a mountain. Over the course of eight rounds, they'll double their workforce, open up new living space in the mountain, construct new buildings and rooms in which to live, and dig for precious metals.

In more detail, each player starts the game with an individual player board that's covered with a random assortment of face-down building/room tiles and only one space. Some tiles are face up and available for purchase at the start of play. Four action tiles lie face up as well. At the start of each of the eight rounds, one new action tile is revealed, then players alternate taking actions, with the number of actions increasing from two up to four over the course of the game. As players excavate their mountainous player board, new building and room tiles are added to the pool; some rooms can be used immediately when acquired, whereas others require the use of an action tile.

After eight rounds, players tally their points for buildings constructed and gold collected to see who wins.

In Caverna: Cave vs Cave – Era II, players start exploring a side cave abundant in ore. Donkeys help you move the ore to the surface so that you can cast iron and forge weapons out of it — to protect your cave from anyone who wishes it harm, of course. In the meantime, your tribe has grown four primates capable of work. Keep on collecting grains, fibers, and building resources to increase your wealth. Shortly you will be engaging in agriculture...

Caverna: Cave vs Cave – The Big Box contains all of the material in the base game and first expansion in a single package.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Versions & Editions: Big Box Versions of Individual Games
Versions & Editions: Two-Player Versions of More-Player Games

boardgame.name: Daimyo Senso
boardgame.description:
Manufactured in the USA!

Daimyo Senso is a 1-8 player game where each player takes the role of a 16th century Japanese daimyo in conquest to become the next Shogun. Players take turns during 4 seasons per year for 4 years, using predetermined commands during each season. Those commands are Move, Deploy, or Attack. Once per year, each daimyo may use one special skill, which amplifies the power of one of their commands. At the end of each year, players tally up their total Castles, Cities, and Fortresses and are awarded Honor based on that total.

The game is over after 4 years, and the player with the most Honor wins.

In single player, the board is set up with significantly more troops, and the player must battle through all of them to completely conquer 5 Regions within 4 years. This race against the clock also acts to help players understand the Actions and General Cards.

Edit: There are now additional multiplayer rules for playing the game out until only one player is left. This is an optional way to play, and makes the game much longer, but is still as strategic and even more desperately gratifying when a long-term plan comes together through alliance, deceit, and careful planning. Another optional rule sets the board up with all daimyo present even in a less-than-8 player game.

Each faction in the game is asymmetrical, and each has its own 4 special skills, called General Cards. The factions include:
Oda - Beginning in south central Honshu, the Oda clan has powerful General Cards that allow him to wage war heavily and assign his armies to the most crucial battlefronts.
Uesugi - The Uesugi clan's attacks are bolstered by powerful generals, and his tactical movements and deployments insure that his armies are where they need to be.
Takeda - While the mighty Takeda war machine has deceptively light attack powers, their troop movements and deployments make them extremely able to defend their hard-won gains.
Hojo - The Hojo employ shinobi, which allows them to completely fool their enemies. While an enemy may think the Hojo are weak on on front, their armies can immediately arrive on the opposite end of their kingdom, shocking enemies into submission.
Miyoshi - The Miyoshi use deception and surprise tactics to hit their enemies where they're weakest. Their powerful navy insures their ability to suddenly appear on any coast at any time.
Mori - The Mori clan uses cunning to thwart their opponents. Their swift advance through unoccupied territories and their ability to fight on multiple fronts at once make them a headache for any enemy to stop.
Date - The Date clan can assault enemy castles with heroic actions, and their ferocity makes neighboring armies wither. Beware the city of Sendai, as the Date will fiercely defend it.
Shimazu - From the southern tip of Kyushu, the Shimazu wage war with their enemies to the North and East. The Shimazu are supported by the people, who rush to join their cause.

-description from designer

listing.notes: These are new, from the publisher. Domestic (inside the USA) shipping is inexpensive (averages about $16), but international shipping is currently significantly more.

boardgame.name: Furnace: Playmat
boardgame.description:
Unroll the true industrial market offer with this elegant playmat designed to turn each game of Furnace into an exquisite experience!

The box contains a large (680 × 260 mm) language-independent neoprene playmat that can be used for the Furnace board game. The board game is to be purchased separately.


Convenient layout for each Auction Phase
Neat resource storage throughout the game
Magnificently designed elegance

listing.notes:
Brand new.
Shipping to EU would be 10 euro and the package should arrive in 7-10 days. Elsewhere – please ask!
Check out my other products for sale as well! If you buy multiple items, I will combine shipping costs. It’s much cheaper this way.

boardgame.description:
Game Trade Magazine
Issue No. 252
February

Lizard Wizard: The Magic Age in the Land of Astoria
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: Back to the Future: Back in Time Strategy Game
Unlock the Secrets of Umbra Via

boardgame.name: Rabbit Rabbit: A Game of Superstitions
boardgame.description:
A magical 350-card trivia game for 1-10 players collecting superstitions, myths, spells, folklore, and more- old and new, from around the world.

The goal of Rabbit Rabbit is to be the first to collect seven cards by answering questions correctly, and play starts with the person whose birthday is closest to the current date.

In clockwise order, players take turns answering question cards pulled from the top of the deck by the person to their right, taking care to keep the answer hidden. If the player answers it correctly, they keep the card. If they don't, it's discarded.

When you win your sixth card and are one card away from winning, you must say "Rabbit Rabbit" out loud. If you forget and another player notices and says it first, skip your next turn, giving everyone else a chance to catch up.

There are multiple ways to play:

Team Play. If you're playing with four or more players, you can optionally split up into teams of equal size.

Host Mode. Playing with three or more, and have an odd number of players? Designate one player as the Trivia Host, who opts out of answering cards, and instead has card reading duties.

Scored Play. If you'd like a faster pace, the host can open up each question card to all players, and everyone who answers correctly each round gets a point. The first to reach seven points wins.

Solo Play. Playing by yourself? Read the cards, challenge yourself to answer them correctly, and see if you're right.

Important Note: Superstitions, like all folklore, can vary wildly and change over time, with multiple variations even in the same small region. If you find a superstition in Rabbit Rabbit described differently than one that you grew up with and hold close to your heart, you're strongly encouraged to share your version with everyone. That storytelling is part of the game!

Rabbit Rabbit is the third game from Ami Baio of Pink Tiger Games, the creator of You Think You Know Me and Flatter Me: A Compliment Battle Card Game.

-description from designer
boardgame.commerceweblink: Geek Game Shop listing for Rabbit Rabbit: A Game of Superstitions

boardgame.name: Diceberg Alley
boardgame.description:
Diceberg Alley is a route building, “push your luck” strategy game.

Theme:

Canada’s famous “iceberg alley” is now partly frozen. Form an expedition to navigate among icebergs and safely collect newly discovered, valuable “dicecubes”.

Roll dice, make paths from frozen ice sheets, avoid dangerous denizens and climb icebergs to collect "dicecubes". Gather the most “dicecube” points to win.

Lasercut Components:

• 30 interlocking wooden game boards
• 30 icebergs (wooden or acrylic)
• Four sets of 30 polyomino ice sheets (wooden or acrylic)
• 30 acrylic “dicecubes”
• Four explorer meeples
• 30 destination cards
• 20 action cards
• Two polar bears, one narwhal, one giant walrus
• pair of dice.

Setup

• shuffle the game boards
• interlock all or most of the game boards in any interesting combination
• take turns randomly inserting all of the icebergs
• give each player a set of coloured ice sheet tiles and their matching explorer meeple
• players place their explorer on the iceberg nearest them numbered 1-9
• shuffle all of the destination cards and action cards
• optionally take five destination cards and remove their respective icebergs from the gameboard
• give each player three to five primary destination cards in secret
• give each player one action card
• each player places any one of their ice sheets adjacent to their explorer
• with the dicecubes upside down, randomly place one on each unoccupied island

Game Play

Basically, you will roll dice, build routes and collect dicecubes. Roll two dice to build your route or roll one die to either move or collect. Otherwise play your action card.

When building your route:
• roll both dice
• grab an ice sheet that has the same number as on one of the dice
• lay the ice sheet next to an existing ice sheet with the other die roll number such that both numbers are adjacent
• if you rolled doubles, see double roll rules below
• stack ice sheet segments as necessary to be at the same level as the top of an iceberg.

When moving your explorer:
• roll a single die and move your explorer
• keep rolling until the explorer can reach an iceberg
• when adjacent to an iceberg and on the same level, flip over its dicecube
• an explorer cannot move within range of any animal

Using your action card:
• played to thwart your opponent. An example is move the walrus to the nearest [die roll] ice sheet
• maintain one action card at all times - can be exchanged in lieu of a turn.

Ending the Game

Upon the last dicecube being obtained, everyone reveals their cards and counts their treasure points. The person with the most points wins. The youngest wins any tie.

Climbing Icebergs

In order to collect the dicecube, the explorer must stack one or more ice sheet segments in steps to be level with the top of the iceberg. Your explorer can then step onto the iceberg to collect its dicecube. To stack, roll both dice - one number on the ice sheet segment must match the number on the ice sheet segment beneath. The tallest iceberg needs two staggered steps to be level with its top.
 
-description from designer

boardgame.name: Immer fleißig nach der "30"
boardgame.description:
Each player has his own game board. If there are more than 6 players, two may play on each game board as a team. The players have to move their cover piece from space 1 to space 30. Movement is determined by a die. The first to reach space 30 wins the game an the first prize, be it money, bear or cigars.
There are six variants to play the game.

In 1919 this game was promoted as the best parlor dice game ever!

—user summary

boardgame.name: Thunderscape Archetypes: Arbiter
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the world of Aden, there is one constant in the enforcement of law and the defense of the innocent: the Arbiters! Whether serving as the inquisitors of the Church of All Saints looking after their flock in the theocratic Carraway, or the knights of the Radiant Order protecting the people of Arasteen, or even the nomadic Outriders patrolling the Sundered Desert, an arbiter can take many forms. Wielding the traditional combination of a blade and shield, arbiters are the scourge of criminals and Nocturnals all throughout the Known Lands!

This first installment in the Thunderscape Archetypes series brings the most iconic roles from the World of Aden to Savage Worlds: Adventurer Edition! All the material that was printed for Arbiters in our original Savage Thunderscape core book for Explorer Edition has been revised and updated for Adventure Edition, and we've added so much more! New Edges of every type, new weapons, new armor, new magic items, and more, all packaged together with enough background on the Arbiters to play them in whatever campaign world you want, or to bring the World of Aden to life at your table!

boardgame.name: The Blessing That Drew Blood
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Blessing that Drew Blood is part of our ongoing series of entertaining scenarios set in the Duchy of Ubersreik, the primary setting of the WFRP Starter Set.

Geheimnisnacht — the dreaded night when the Chaos Moon waxes full — is almost upon Ubersreik’s citizens. A foreboding atmosphere permeates the town, and the sense of fear and dread is palpable. A spate of killings has occurred — adding to the terror. The murderers, whomever they may be, seem to target victims from amongst Ubersreik’s holy orders. As Geheimnisnacht draws closer, the killings become more frequent. The city’s priests demand justice for their brothers and sisters, whilst preaching to all to remain vigilant for the merest trace of Chaos flourishing under Morrslieb’s light.

Ubersreik Adventures: The Blessing that Drew Blood includes:

A dark and gripping adventure by Dave Allen, allowing your players to delve into a sinister murder mystery.
The setting of Ubersreik, as detailed in the WFRP Starter Set, with new locations and citizens described.
New minor spells of Slaanesh, designed to inconvenience and embarrass the most stoic of investigators.

boardgame.name: Siege Command
boardgame.description:
Siege Command is a two-player, lane-based strategy game containing a mixture of simultaneous planning and turn-based strategy. Deploying a variety of Units and casting powerful Spells, players battle for control over the Turrets in each of the 4 lanes in order to destroy their opponent's walls.

In the simultaneous Planning Phase, both players place a Unit card from their hand face-down in front of each of the 4 lanes (or a Bluff card to hide their intent) and Spell cards off to the side of the battlefield. Once both players are ready, they reveal their played cards, pay the combined energy cost, and attempt to predict their opponent's strategy before proceeding to the turn-based Action Phase.

In the Action Phase, both players alternate resolving a single card at a time until all cards on the table have been resolved. Players can choose to resolve any Spell or Unit on the table in any order they wish. When resolving Units, players must resolve all of its Action Points in a single activation and then exhaust that Unit for the duration of the round. The main objective during this phase is to establish and maintain control over the battlefield and Turrets, while trying to keep Units alive long enough to reach the opponent's walls.

After the Action Phase, any captured Turrets deal damage directly to the controller's opponent and the game proceeds to the next round following a quick Refresh Phase. Gameplay continues in this manner over several rounds until one player (or both) reach 0 health. If one of the players remains with at least 1 health, they are declared the winner - if not, the game ends with both players standing among the smoldering ashes of their outpost in a draw.

boardgame.name: Black Circle Interludes
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Black Circle is Watching

Once in a while a referee requires a small adventure that can be run between other adventures in an ongoing campaign. Here are three adventures you can use to give your players a glimpse into the gritty side of the Aliens & Asteroids universe.

The Black Circle is a criminal organization barely whispered in the dark for fear of attracting their interest. Whether on the street or in the boardroom, the BC demands respect and has the power to make entire corporations disappear into thin air.

Your heroes will be flung across the stars to help bring these criminals to justice, eventually ending up at home on Earth. Can they help the Dominion Defense Service catch thieves at the highest levels of government? Only time will tell!

Good luck, Marines! OOH-RAH!

Among the details Included are:

Expanded versions of The Take, The Target, and The Trap -- adventures you can drop into your Aliens & Asteroids campaign to spice things up!
Details about the Dominion Defense Service, a brand new profession for PCs!
More than a dozen new toys and tools for battle and espionage!
And details about The Black Circle and how you can incorporate them into your games!

boardgame.name: Rescue of the Blackthorn Clan (PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Romance and RPGs? We think they’re a match made in heaven.

We here at Urban Realms have been playing role-playing games together for twenty years. We get together with friends around a table, or a computer, and enjoy a slice of fantasy and adventure. But in all those years we’ve never come across a game specifically made for a couple to play together. We wanted to create something where both could be players and enjoy the unfolding story, not where one knew all that would happen and spelled out the story for the other. So we created Date Night Dungeons.

The goal is for the players to not only have a fun adventure but also to spark romance. It’s perfect for date night, whether the players are just getting to know each other or have been together for years.

The Big Idea

The idea is that each partner is both GM and player, and mysteries unfold for both as the story moves forward. We’ve divided the adventure into four scenarios. Players are encouraged to switch GM duties for each scenario and to not read past the current scenario to avoid spoilers. That way, both partners get to be players, and the mystery lasts until the final scenario. This is a fleshed-out RPG module that is Pathfinder 1 compatible and complete with locations, maps, backstories, character sheets, NPCs, and baddies.

Bring on the Romance

To facilitate the romance, we’ve also added a few extras, like Attraction Points, Turn-ons, and Pet Peeves. These keep your mind focused on the romance as our characters battle villains and solve mysteries. There are romance roll throughout. It’s the dice, though, that decide if our characters fall for each other or can’t wait to get rid of each other. Then again, isn’t love always a roll of the dice?

The Story

The heir to the Blackthorn power and fortune is being held for ransom. Now it’s up to the head of security at the manor to get the heir back. But when they learn that the kidnappers mean to kill the Thane as well, they must work together to find out who is behind the plot and why. They soon learn that things are far more sinister than they first appeared. Now they must foil the mastermind’s evil plot before the planes of hell break loose – if they can.

So light some candles, set the mood, and let the adventure begin.

boardgame.name: Rescue of the Blackthorn Clan (3.5)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Romance and RPGs? We think they’re a match made in heaven.

We here at Urban Realms have been playing role-playing games together for twenty years. We get together with friends around a table, or a computer, and enjoy a slice of fantasy and adventure. But in all those years we’ve never come across a game specifically made for a couple to play together. We wanted to create something where both could be players and enjoy the unfolding story, not where one knew all that would happen and spelled out the story for the other. So we created Date Night Dungeons.

The goal is for the players to not only have a fun adventure but also to spark romance. It’s perfect for date night, whether the players are just getting to know each other or have been together for years.

The Big Idea

The idea is that each partner is both GM and player, and mysteries unfold for both as the story moves forward. We’ve divided the adventure into four scenarios. Players are encouraged to switch GM duties for each scenario and to not read past the current scenario to avoid spoilers. That way, both partners get to be players, and the mystery lasts until the final scenario. This is a fleshed-out RPG module that is Pathfinder 1 compatible and complete with locations, maps, backstories, character sheets, NPCs, and baddies.

Bring on the Romance

To facilitate the romance, we’ve also added a few extras, like Attraction Points, Turn-ons, and Pet Peeves. These keep your mind focused on the romance as our characters battle villains and solve mysteries. There are romance roll throughout. It’s the dice, though, that decide if our characters fall for each other or can’t wait to get rid of each other. Then again, isn’t love always a roll of the dice?

The Story

The heir to the Blackthorn power and fortune is being held for ransom. Now it’s up to the head of security at the manor to get the heir back. But when they learn that the kidnappers mean to kill the Thane as well, they must work together to find out who is behind the plot and why. They soon learn that things are far more sinister than they first appeared. Now they must foil the mastermind’s evil plot before the planes of hell break loose – if they can.

So light some candles, set the mood, and let the adventure begin.

boardgame.name: Tiny Living Dead
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Dead Have Risen!

Tiny Living Dead is a micro-expansion for the TinyD6 ruleset. While the bulk of the book is a stripped down TinyD6 game designed to emulate zombie heavy survival horror, Tiny Living Dead does present the following new options:

New Hit Point & Death Rules
A new Zombified power compatible with Tiny Supers
A small treatise on generating zombie foes for TinyD6 games
A small sampling of Zombie enemies


The core of the game is the standard TinyD6 rules, with the above modifications applied, as well as new art!

boardgame.name: Clash of the Genres
boardgame.description:
Clash of the Genres is a 2-4 Player versus Player board game where the last one alive wins! Players will use a shared deck of cards while moving and positioning their pawns on a square grid-based battlefield. There are a wide variety of options to take during a Player's turn; Taking attack actions, adding Equipment, summoning a helpful Ally, or affecting the board with area-of-effect Zones.

The "Genres" represent classic references from media and pop culture. Action, Horror, Sci-Fi, Fantasy, and more are all represented in this tactical death battle. Choose your Player Pawn and jump into the fray, with different game modes to choose from.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Great Plains
그레이트 플레인스
boardgame.description:
Our ancient ancestors created images on the walls of caves to tell stories about the world around them and the animals they shared it with — and perhaps they, like you, played games to make those stories come to life...

Great Plains is a mysterious game about a not-so-mysterious behavior of our kind: two players competing for the dominance over the Great Plains! With help from the spiritual animal world, they overcome hills, cross the lowlands, and invade each other's territory in order to become the tribe who will live on.
boardgame.boardgamehonor: 2022 UK Games Expo Best Abstract Game Nominee

boardgame.name: Glücks-Würfel + Würfel-Bingo
boardgame.description:
Glücks-Würfel (2 players)
The game is played on the black and white game board. Each player (black and red) has 4 meeples. The players roll two black dices and a red die. The eyes of the black dice are added and multiplied with the eyes of the red die. If the result is a number printed on the bottom row of the game board, the player places a meeple on this number (red: 4, 6, 9,12; black: 5, 7, 8, 10). If a meeple sits on the bottom row it may be moved to the next row, if a corresponding number is rolled and so on. Each meeple on the 4th (last) row gets the player an extra dice roll per turn. The first player with all 4 meeples on the last row wins the game.

Würfel-Bingo (2-12 players)
Each player may buy 1 or more bingo cards. The players roll two black dice and a red one. The results are determined like in the first game. If a player has the result on his bingo card, he covers the number with a token. The first player to cover 5 numbers in a row shouts "bingo" and wins the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Lamaland
Llamaland
라마랜드
boardgame.description:
The plateaus are wild, stunningly beautiful, and...full of llamas?!

Being a farmer in Llamaland isn't exactly easy with all the hills and mountains around, but even so, growing potatoes, corn, and cocoa on the slopes of the mountains is what you love. Luckily the llamas are a big help, too!

By fitting your fields in giddy heights, you gain the necessary crops in order to obtain the desired llama cards. These cards not only provide victory points, but also allow you to place a llama on your farm. After about 45 minutes, you will have an impressive crop-growing area in front of you, including your sweet and cuddly llamas.

boardgame.name: Prismot!: A Troikawave Zine
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A new zine for Troika! filled with the boundless optimism of the late 80s and early 90s!
Including:

6 backgrounds
6 spells
2 enemies
a table of things found in the trash
a Bonus Magic Item!!!
cool 3d glasses to cut out and wear*


[*]not actually 3d glasses

boardgame.name: Prismot 2
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The second issue of the beloved zine for Troika! filled with the runaway affluence of the late 80s and early 90s!
Including:

6 backgrounds
4 magic items
2 spells
6 snacks
5 enemies

boardgame.name: Gods of Metal: Ragnarock
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME




This game has not been released yet, therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please don't submit images for it unless given direct written permission from the publisher which must be noted in the image caption.




Gods of Metal: Ragnarock is a highly energetic, over-the-top RPG filled with glory, teamwork, and adventure. While some games focus more on the blood and pus of metal-inspired gameplay, Gods of Metal: Ragnarock asks you to do things like:

Pledge your allegiance to a Patron Metal God, to create your Outfit, Weapon, and Accessory to create a sweet-ass Avatar who is sure to kick ass (or die magnificently, attempting to ascend to Godhood).

Form bands of adventurers, made up of player Positions (aka player classes) like Brutalizers, Blüdgaards, Howlers, Shredders, Chordmasters, and Amplords.

Fight back against the enemies of Ragnarock, such as The Electric Liches of the Howling Wastes, Pit Demons of Borgourl, The Warlords of Aux, The Proaugr, those f*cking Bose Imps, and Ragnasaurs Rexes! Not to mention all the other Avatars who may get in your way as you seek glory of wild proportions in this heavy metal album inspired world!

boardgame.name: Doctor Doctor!
boardgame.description:
Doctor Doctor! is a morbidly funny turn-based competitive strategy game about saving patients while surviving a day at the hospital. Each player assumes the role of a hospital staffer and must take care of 3 patients at a time.

Players take turns drawing from the Rounding deck on their own patients and staffers while playing cards from their hand on their opponents. The Rounding deck is comprised of cards that can help treat patients, make their conditions worse, move them around the table, prevent staff from treating their patients, and modify other cards in play.

When a patient is saved or pronounced dead, players must clear them from play and draw a new one from the Patient deck. Just like in a real hospital!

Once the last patient has been drawn, players race to be the first to clear the patients in front of them. Then they tally their Save Scores (saved minus dead) to determine the winner!

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: The Cave of Despair, Part 2
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Having rescued a young man named Longinus from the grip of darkness, the lightraiders are chased into a cave fortress in the heart of the Gloomy Forest (Sil Belom in the Elder Tongue) by a band of mounted coal orcs. This same dungeon imprisons Featherking the talking eagle, and his companions Archer the white tailed deer and Silvestrano the deer mouse. Master Carthia spoke of their importance in the Rescuer’s plans and tasked the lightraiders with their rescue. Though outwardly it seems the lightraiders have fallen into grave danger, they are exactly where they need to be — in the center of the Rescuer’s will — truly and always the safest place to be.

In the complex, the lightraiders must survive the traps and enemies, free the talking animals, and ultimately confront the dragon lord of the Sil Belom. If they escape, their adventure becomes a heart pounding race to save as many Aladoth as they can before they are killed in the Reckoning, the dragon’s purge. The talking animals assist in presenting the Great Rescue and breaking the chains of guilt in the heart of anyone who will listen.

Once the mission is complete, the lightraiders say their goodbyes and return to Ras Telesar where Master Carthia presents their rewards and offers up the next assignment.

boardgame.name: DreamWeavers
boardgame.description:
Where dreams come from...
Inside the unconscious mind of every being lives the world of dreams. Morpheus, the orchestrator of Nightmares and Paradise has filled countless minds with terror and wonder.

Over time Morpheus recruited help; he’s named them DreamWeavers, architects of the unconscious. It’s once again time for new recruits to join the realm!

Players form two teams, taking turns influencing a subject’s dream with their actions.
During their turn players will do 1 of the following:
- Draw cards and gain resources
- Play a card into the play area
- Complete an Objective
- Claim a dream (to score points)

The game progresses each time players draw a specific card (Suns). When 8 of these Sun cards
have been drawn the game ends.

DreamWeavers uses a Scoreboard as a point system. Teams will need to accumulate two types of points, (Nightmare and Paradise Stars). The Teams’ final score will be the lowest of the two types.

boardgame.name: The Elder Scrolls Online - Blackwood
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Continuation of the Elder Scroll Online - and the Gates of Oblivion story.

Explore the imperial cities and creepy bogs to reveal Mehrunes Dagons evil scheme.
boardgame.videogameexpansion: The Elder Scrolls Online: Tamriel Unlimited

boardgame.name: Rivet Heads
boardgame.description:
In Rivet Heads, you're the boss of the most badass squad of mercs, fixers, and runners in the Sprawl. Make deals to secure top-of-the-line upgrades for your crew, and score the most rep by the end of three cycles.

Any time your marker is the one on the card closest to the deck, you will take the following actions:
1: Add the card that is currently underneath your marker to position 1 of your assembly line. You may add it either action side or scoring side up.
2. Choose a card in the new row by placing your marker on it.
3. Activate your assembly line and update your upgrade trackers accordingly. Discard the card in position THREE of your assembly line and slide the 2 remaining cards down to open up position ONE once again. If the card was on its action side, then it is discarded, if it was on its scoring side then add it to your score pile.
4. The player whose marker is now closest to the deck takes their turn.

Once the final player has taken their actions, form a new row of cards and a new round can start with the player whose marker is placed on the card closest to the deck. When a Cycle deck runs out, move on to the next Cycle deck in sequence until all cards have been chosen.

Once the Cycle 3 deck is empty and all cards have been chosen, continue activating your assembly line until all cards have left your assembly line. (i.e. the final card you chose will activate a full 3 times) Then move on to scoring.

-description from artist

boardgame.name: The Pathfinder Trials
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for level 1.

Every year, the Pathfinder Society inducts new classes of recruits into their ranks. The three deans of the Society's schools, the Spells, Scrolls, and Swords, are responsible for ensuring that the new recruits have the basic skills and experience necessary to thrive in the field. PCs participating in this adventure will get to meet all three of the Society's deans and undergo their unique challenges, proving their worth and fitness to join the Pathfinder Society!

boardgame.name: The Road From Otari
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Pathfinder Bounty designed for Level 1.

Hired to deliver packages from the small fishing village of Otari to the metropolis of Absalom, the PCs encounter halfling traders who have suffered a strange attack and confront a subterranean creature that’s surfaced to hunt.

boardgame.name: Frozen Ambitions: The Preluria Connection
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Starfinder Society Scenario designed for levels 1-4.

A representative of a well-known pacifist faction within the Pact Worlds contracts a team of Starfinders under pretenses of touring their world, only to task them with tracking down a missing agent on a nearby moon. These Starfinders quickly find themselves caught in a web of shady deals and mercenary intrigue as they search for connections in perilous places.

boardgame.name: The Vast Experiment: Fast Choices
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A Starfinder Society Scenario designed for levels 5-8.

Caught in a feud between rival starship manufacturers, the Society must side with one in order to secure important technology for their new generation starship. From infiltrating a gala, to heading out into the depths of space to chase down a stolen ship, the Starfinder Society has a long road ahead of it to complete this mission. However, there’s always the possibility that the other manufacturer may make an offer the Starfinders can’t refuse?

boardgame.name: Professional Courtesy
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A favor for their best friend and ally brings the player characters to the ocean planet of Entha, which the Company is terraforming into a paradise for rich dilettantes. The churning water world is home to many mysteries, including a fantastic underwater realm of powerful magic. Now the crew must save an underwater rig from destruction, rescue the workers there, and somehow win the friendship of a strange alien species. But the Company manager on Entha is a dragon, she's got a team of aquatic alien troubleshooters, and the PCs are the trouble that needs to be shot.

"Professional Courtesy" is a Starfinder adventure for four 5th-level characters. This adventure continues the Fly Free or Die Adventure Path, a six-part monthly campaign in which players take on the role of a merchant crew with an experimental starship, trying to get rich, escape interplanetary assassins, and outwit their rivals. This volume also details the aquatic world of Entha and its many dangerous and intelligent inhabitants, a well-armed Company warship, gear and character options for underwater adventures, and a series of "Side Jobs"—short mini-adventures the GM can insert into the campaign at any time.

boardgame.name: Merchants of the Void
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The crew of the Oliphaunt have earned the freedom to go where they please, but they've still got bills to pay and old enemies hot on their tail! The Fly Free or Die Adventure Path continues, as the player characters travel to the Veskarium, an interplanetary empire ruled by the militant and lizard-like Vesk, where the crew must become smugglers and bounty hunters, capturing illegal resources in the turbulent storms of a gas giant! But along the way, they're forced to make some tough decisions that will come back to haunt them later, attracting the anger of the Vesk military itself. Can the player characters keep running forever, or will they eventually turn, stand, and fight for their lives?

"Merchants of the Void" is a Starfinder adventure for four 3rd-level characters. This adventure continues the Fly Free or Die Adventure Path, a six-part monthly campaign in which players take on the role of a merchant crew with an experimental starship, trying to get rich, escape interplanetary assassins, and outwit their rivals. This volume also details a crew of smugglers who cross the players at every turn, their starship, a collection of alien threats, a mysterious tropical paradise planet, and a series of “Side Jobs”—short mini-adventures the GM can insert into the campaign at any time.

boardgame.name: Elusive Victory: Aircraft Data Cards
boardgame.description:
35 Aircraft Data cards for GMT's Elusive Victory

35 Data cards for the aircraft found in the game Elusive Victory by T. Simo (GMT Games). Includes the additional aircraft found in C3i. Ownership of the game is required to enjoy this product.

All data on the aircraft cards are copyrighted GMT Games. Back Cover images by Christophe Gibelin & Roy Cross.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Elusive Victory: The Air War over the Suez Canal, 1967-1973

boardgame.name: Red Storm: Aircraft & SAM cards
boardgame.description: 72 cards deck of data cards for the aircraft plus mini deck of 15 cards for the SAMs found in the game Red Storm by GMT.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Red Storm: The Air War Over Central Germany, 1987

boardgame.name: JigStars
boardgame.description:
Let's play JigStars! Grab the best jigsaw pieces and build the best puzzle. The player whose puzzle is worth the most points is the winner.

JigStars is a speed game for 2–4 players. Each player starts with a large double jigsaw piece in front of them. This is the beginning of their own puzzle.

Players take turns to reach into the bag and pull out a random handful of jigsaw pieces and then drop them in the middle of the table. Everyone races to grab a piece they want, and then adds to their own puzzle.

When all the pieces have been used up, players score a point for each complete coloured diamond they created and for each star on corner pieces. The player with the most points wins.

Contents:

4 large jigsaw pieces
48 small jigsaw pieces
1 drawstring bag


-description from designer

boardgame.name: Downtown: Aircraft cards
boardgame.description: 53 Aircraft Data cards for the aircraft found in the game Downtown by GMT.

boardgame.name: To Save a World
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

One of the planets of the System Confederacy is facing an ecological crisis. Top scientists throughout the system are working desparately to stop what could result in the collapse of a significant portion of the planet's biome. Mass extinctions could result, and the planet's populace is facing starvation without massive amounts of interplanetary aid or the inhabitants seeking refuge off-planet. The buvai, a space-faring race from the Vast that the Confederacy made contact with years ago was particularly advanced in the field of bioengineering. It is hoped that their scientific minds might find a way to resolve the crisis. A group of volunteers must travel to the buvai's distant homeworld with the Confederacy's plea for help, and hopefully return with aid.

boardgame.name: Ragnarok Tunnels
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

A local noble has sent two previous expeditions to the Ragnarok Tunnels to hunt down a thief who stole his valuable visionary orb. They failed! Your group, armed with a magical orckilling sword and plenty of healing salves, makes their way to the entrance only to see a horde of orcs guarding the way. This is just one of many obstacles your valiant group of adventurers will face in these dangerous Ragnarok Tunnels. As you encounter the many personalities within, will you ally with them, kill them or find yourself trusting no one and fighting alone?

This is a GM scenario adventure for Deluxe Tunnels & Trolls. You will need the rulebook, paper, pencils, some six-sided dice and some courageous friends to play this adventure.

boardgame.name: Flames of War: Firestorm Mini Campaign – Caen: Operation Overlord
boardgame.description:
Firestorm: Caen focuses on the British and Canadian landings on Gold, Juno and Sword beaches right up to Operation Goodwood. It is a full-sized campaign but has special rules for smaller groups or even a two-player option. There are five turns in all, each named after the major operations for each time period; Neptune, Perch, Epsom, Charnwood and Goodwood. Covering the period between 6 June to 20 July 1944.

Firestorm campaigns give players the opportunity to play Flames Of War games in a larger context and give every game a greater meaning.

Firestorm: Caen is best suited for standard 1000-1500 point games.

boardgame.name: Au fil d'une conquête
boardgame.description:
Discover the Bayeux Tapestry;
Learn about the adventures of Edward the Confessor and Harold, the last Anglo-saxon kings of England but also William, Duke of Normandy, Odon, Bishop of Bayeux and more;
Reconstruct scenes from the tapestry.

'Gameplay

Reach the key places of a medieval conquest, moving through a labyrinth;
To win, you must collect a maximum of cards by defeating the traps and attacks of your opponents;
You will become the hero if you are the first to unite 4 episodes


Discover the Bayeux Tapestry and learn of the adventures of William, Duke of Normandy, and Harold, King of England, as they reconstruct scenes from the tapestry in this game.

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Die Schweizer Schlösser
Monopoly: Les Châteaux suisses
boardgame.description:
Monopoly, the famous real estate transaction game, takes you in this edition to discover many Swiss castles.

Incredible adventures await in the castles and fortified castles of the national association les châteaux suisses! They offer tours, events and shows and are ideal for excursions and relaxation. Whether as a hiking destination, as the final stop on a boat trip, as a highlight of a city tour or simply out of a thirst for knowledge, a visit to a castle is always part of a global experience. These monuments are located in idyllic settings: they sit on top of hills, stretch out by a lake or embody the symbol of a city.

boardgame.name: Monopoly: Neuchâtel
boardgame.description:
Neuchâtel is a French-speaking canton, located in French-speaking Switzerland. It can be represented in four major regions. Along Lake Neuchâtel is the region called Littoral. The city of Neuchâtel is established on the right bank of the lake. To the north, passing through the Chaumont, is the Val-de-Ruz.

West of Neuchâtel, still in the Littoral, is the alluvial cone of the mouth of the Areuse. The valley narrows further to the west in a narrow gorge and then opens onto the Val-de-Travers. The Canton of Neuchâtel is also the cradle of the most prestigious watch brands.

Don't forget, like in any other Monopoly, do not get bankrupted to win !

boardgame.name: Big Trouble: XXV
boardgame.description:
From Product Page:
XXV is a free Hero/Monster Card expansion for the Big Trouble rpg series that introduces 2 new playable heroes plus 2 new monsters in both b&w and color versions. Included are:

Heroes: Bull Rider and Quarterback

Monsters: Giant Pacific Salamander and Mutant Buffalo Leafhopper

Requires: Big Trouble Settings Guide and Rules

boardgame.name: Kobold Nightmare
boardgame.description:
"QUESTion: Are you ready for the adventure of your dreams?
Kobold Nightmare is a solo adventure for your character. Combat is scaled by proficiency bonus so any level character can play. Quest your way through a waking nightmare pitting you alone against Kurtulmak, god of kobolds! But are you alone? Is this really a dream?

Use your wits to gain magical abilities and wondrous items. Or power through and gain UNspiration. The choice is yours."

(Author Summary)

boardgame.name: Go Master: Youtubers
boardgame.description:
A board game about controlling your own YouTube channel and reach the most subscribers - who will reach the 100.000 first?

The game consists of a number of challenges, that must be dealt with to advance in the game. Move up form "Noob" to "Pro" to "top-creator" and end the game by creating an unforgettable story to your YouTube channel to become the master YouTuber.

Watch out for trolls by your opponents during the game.

There's also a free app to the game.

boardgame.name: Tribal Souls
boardgame.description:
Strategic game inspired by Native American legends.
Beautiful mechanics for a game balance that goes beyond even randomness.

1-6 players.
1 hour of play.

The goal will be to dispel the Anamaqkiu and become the most popular tribe of the descendants of Honiahaka (Little Wolf). To do this you will have to find artifacts or get help from the souls of the dead that your tribe will suffer, and invoke so powerful spirits. An "Area Movement" strategic game but with an advanced "Set Collection" heart thanks to multifunctional cards, combined with a "Pattern Building".

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: A Collection of Low Power Archetypes
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a collection of over 50 fully playable archetypes, from well-known classics to originals, converted to be used with the world's greatest superhero RPG. These archetypes function as heroes in low-PL games, basic ideas to be upgraded to high-PL heroes, super-powered thugs, allies, minions, or sidekicks.

boardgame.name: Super Powered Advantages
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a collection of 30 super-powered Advantages for the world's greatest superhero RPG.

Many settings and character concepts simply don't match with Powers, as described in the core book. For these characters, many low-cost Powers can be converted into Advantages and obtained with a different flavor.

For settings with a foot on realism, this title also includes Weapon Style and Proficiency Advantages and rules.

boardgame.name: The Big Old Vault of Relics and Curiosities
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Big Old Vault of Relics and Curiosities is an ongoing collection of alternative rules, rulings, systems, and ideas for ICRPG and OSR Games that serves as a source of inspiration for GMs and players.

In this version of the Vault you will find ideas about:

The Joy of Low Hit Points, where we talk about hit points in games and how reducing them and all the math associated can create an unique cinematographic experience for combat.

Player-Facing Combat, and the idea that players should always be the active part in any conflict, rolling to hit, damage... And avoid attacks made against them, freeing the GM to do what the GM should do, focus on everything not dice-rolling related.

Luck as an OSR Mechanic, an original mechanic that measures Luck in a dice chain (D4, D6, D8...) and gives players a new way to influence the game and negotiate narrative advantages.

Alternative Wealth Systems, simplifying the math for when no one wants to track every copper and allowing GMs to create the monetary system they prefer for the game, from the classic generic gold pieces to barter and trade systems.

As with all products in this series, this title is offered as PWYW and will receive constant support and update, with new ideas and adventure seeds being added regularly - buyers will be notified when a new version becomes available, so if you believe this product to be worth of your support, please return to this page and contribute in the future.

boardgame.name: Journey to the Lands of Summer
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

ICRPG ADVENTURE: JOURNEY TO THE LANDS OF SUMMER is the first in a series of One Shot Adventures for ICRPG covering many different settings and styles, to take full advantage of this system's flexibility. Titles in this series will bring GM and Players to adventures in the prehistoric times, ancient Rome, modern day Earth, and others.

In this adventure, set in a prehistoric time of snow, ice, megafauna, supernatural wisdom, and tribal wars, the Heroes will have to guide their people into the future and follow their mysterious Seer's visions in search for an unknown paradise land, all the while dealing with the dangers of the land and a brewing civil war.

This product requires the ICRPG Core Rulebook 2nd Edition and the [Blood & Snow] setting book, both published by Runehammer Games.

boardgame.name: ICRPG Hack: Combat Styles - Character Options Vol. 2
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

ICRPG HACK: COMBAT STYLES is the second in a series of books bringing new character options. In this book, GMs and players will find rules for five combat styles with new and powerful maneuvers: Archery, Dual Weapon, Two-Hander, Weapon and Shield, and Weapon and Spell.

As of Jan 20, 2021, this product has been updated to version 1.1, with expanded ideas.

It now includes:

An overhaul of the Weapon Tags from ICRPG Core, adding mechanics to old and new Tags to take advantage of the rules and expand combat options

A couple of Combat Encounter Seeds with the layout of two combat encounters that can be used to test the new rules and adapted to any setting (fantasy, modern, sci-fi).

boardgame.name: Carcassonne: Tile Tower Dispenser
boardgame.description: The Carcassonne Tile Tower holds approx. 164 tiles (depending on thickness of the tiles). Gently pull the two sides apart to release the roof from the castellated top - then load in your tiles. Replace the roof the same way - carefully pull the two sides apart and slide the sides of the roof into place. Removing a tile in play is easy too - just slip your finger underneath at the back of the Tower and push a tile through the slot in the front - take the tile and make your move! The Tile Tower measures 190 high x 115 wide x 55mm deep. Functional, fun and good to look at - careful engraving of castle windows and doors on the sides adds to the Tower's appeal. With the roof on and full of tiles, the Tower can be laid flat with no fear of the tiles falling out.

boardgame.name: ICRPG Hack: Allies As Loot - Character Options Vol. 3
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

ICRPG HACK: ALLIES AS LOOT is the third in a series of books bringing new character options. In this book, GMs and players will find quick and easy rules for using allies and sidekicks in ICRPG, treating them as Loot!

As of Jan 18, 2021, this product has been updated to version 1.1 with expanded ideas on how to use Allies in a campaign and input from the community.

It now also includes the Dragon Riders of Kaarth Campaign Seed, a setting and adventure idea that draws on the full potential of Allies as Loot.

boardgame.name: ICRPG Hack: Halls of the Undead - Character Options Vol. 1
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

ICRPG HACK: HALLS OF THE UNDEAD is the first in a series of books bringing new character options. In this book, GMs and players will find rules for the Undead Bioform (with skeleton, vampire, and zombie variants), the Vampire Class, and short pieces of Vampire Lore to include in any game.

As of Jan 16, 2021, this product has been updated to version 1.1 with expanded ideas.

It now also includes character sheets of vampire spawn, lords, and masters and a micro-setting (a Vampire Island described through places of interest, a lexicon, and a few customized villains).

boardgame.name: Blood and Snow
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Everything you need to play brutal ice age adventures in the ICRPG CORE rule set.

boardgame.name: Showdown at the Oasis
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Gumption is in danger! The remote tavern and its fertile valley have drawn the attention of bandits looking for a permanent headquarters. When the PCs are approached by a hardworking halfling and his adopted children, will they be able to save the day, or will the valley fall into the hands of reavers and marauders?

Showdown at the Oasis is a mini-adventure for the Fifth Edition of the World's Oldest Roleplaying Game suitable for four 4th level characters. It is designed to be used with Tangible Taverns: Gumption.

This Tavern Tale includes a map of the property, two new stat blocks, and an incantation.

boardgame.name: Stingers & Spores: The Leaping Jaws
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The two prosperous villages of Brambleshade and Bitterroot have been completely wiped out! Who is to blame? Who could be next?

Twitchy Butcher Studios is proud to present Stingers & Spores, a dark fantasy romp through the Insect Kingdoms, a harsh land filled with tiny six-legged denizens, exotic cultures beneath every log, and death around every corner.

Powered by the Savage Worlds system, this JumpStart is an introduction to life in the Insect Kingdoms, complete with:

Six new playable races, from the armored beetle and imposing hornet, to the ravenous mantis and spindly stick bug
Three weird and silly new Hindrances for insect characters
Three new Arcane Backgrounds, to give bug characters a dose of magical power
A 13 page adventure (4-6 hours of play time) that puts players in the middle of the wondrous but unforgiving world of insects
Five brand new allies and enemies
Four new Wild Card NPCs, including two formidable enemies, one vicious monster, and an exotic beast ally for the players to befriend
Six pregenerated insect characters in traditional fantasy roles: a barbarian, bug-at-arms, cleric, monk, ranger, and wizard
A detailed character sheet containing all the information a player needs to remember, plus an optional third page for Arcane Background information


Do you have what it takes to save the land from the slimy horror inflicted upon it?

boardgame.name: Sleeping Giant
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is an adventure written Cepheus Engine.

The travelers are offered a job with a substantial payday, The only problem is that the job is on a burned out radioactive world in the Sonora sector of space, An alien species, long dead and gone, once used robotic walkers to invade the planet Ceqal IV. The Olonsean Empire would like to have artifacts from these walkers. The patron, however, has other ideas.

boardgame.name: Villains Fly Zeppelins
boardgame.description:
Grab your whips, your flashbulb cameras, and your side-car motorcycles. Indulge your spirit of daring and dauntless adventure and rise to the occasion. Pit yourself against the evil caprice of cabals, conspiracies, and grandstanding public enemies while VILLAINS FLY ZEPPELINS!

You might be a journalist, armed with little more than a bowie knife and a tome of ancient lore. You're great at brawling, but you're bad at driving. Regardless, it's up to you and your friends to stop the plot of Kitanova Vadimovna, the dread cultist from the USSR whose signature explosions bristle from her heavily-armed sky fortress. Can you work with your contact, Barnaby St. John the fixer, to recover the ebon monkey of Ibn Fatullah before Vadimovna and her goons get to it first? Will you be able to evade the meddling of Illuminati mercenaries pursuing their own ends, but intervening in yours?

The above is a full plot generated across sixteen short d6 tables. A few rolls is all you need to whip up the seed for a complete adventure, a party of "good guys," the villain, their zeppelin, the artifact, and more. The game is run primarily by description, impact, and common sense consequences, with opposed 2d6 to adjudicate situations with unclear outcomes.

boardgame.name: Unlock! 9 Legendarische Avonturen
Unlock!: Legendary Adventures
大搜查第九季 传奇冒险
boardgame.description:
Unlock! Legendary Adventures features three new "escape room" scenarios that you can play on your tabletop.

Unlock! is a co-operative card game inspired by escape rooms that uses a simple system which allows you to search scenes, combine objects, and solve riddles. Play Unlock! to embark on great adventures, while seated at a table using only cards and a companion app that can provide clues, check codes, monitor time remaining, etc. The three scenarios are:


Action Story
Robin Hood: Dead or Alive
Sherlock Holmes - The Case of the Burnt Angels

boardgame.name: Character Expansion Handbook: Biohackers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In this issue of the Character Expansion Handbook, Alexander Augunas unleashes biohacker secrets and serums galore with all-new biohacker class features, fields of research, and theorems. Specialize in new fields such as metamorphology to alter the physiology of friend and foe alike, biomedicine for healing the sick, pathology for manipulating contagions, and more. You'll also be able to specialize in a brand-new type of hybrid medicinal called nostrums, which allow Starfinder characters to create spell gems in drinkable (or injectable form). And what good would such an item be if there wasn't a nostrum specialist biohacker to recreate your favorite alchemical characters? You'll also be able to pick from a massive list of theorems, including new synthesis theorems that allow biohackers to spontaneously generate a limited number of items whenever they rest, whether that be medicinals for saving lives, poisons for ending them, or biotech augmentations for making life a little stranger!

boardgame.name: Dungeon & Pixel Hero
Dungeon & Pixel Hero VIP
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Go around in dungeons in this retro RPG game to fight bosses.

boardgame.name: PUMA RS Game
boardgame.description:
User Summary

8-bit style game where you are a PUMA RS shoe - running ahead: Pick up as many coins as possible and avoid obstacles such as banana peals, poop, traffic cones and pits.

boardgame.name: Versus Tales X
boardgame.description:
Summary of Game

A completely original story, telling the aftermath of myths and fairy tales…

Parallel to our world, there is Otogiland. Born and shaped from human imagination, Otogiland residents are affected by both bright and dark energies emanating from humans.

The protagonist, an ordinary man with tremendous “Elmight”, gets led astray into Otogiland.
Balancing with the Elmight, this world also consists of its counterpart, the “Demight.”
But now, the balance is broken, causing disasters within Otogiland...

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Battles For Athelon
boardgame.description:
Battles for Athelon is an RTS-type game, it takes place in a fantastic world called Athelon where many races coexist, and each one has its own attributes and abilities. Each player must use their actions (which are the workers) to improve their settlement, having to build different buildings that will give them types of units, additional skills and powers to achieve victory, each game has a goal to meet, once it is reached. For this objective the game ends and the point count begins, each building, unit, battle, resource, and other things that are done in the game have a point value; the player with the most points wins the game.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Alice Re:Code X
boardgame.description:
Summary of Game

Are you sick and tired of the same old fantasy games, the same old dull characters, and the same old walking-off-into-the-sunset happy ending? Then this is the game for you!
Follow us down the rabbit hole and enter the dark fantastical world of Alice Re:Code, a fairytale where horror, love and madness await at every corner! A crazy wonderland in which 12 far from normal heroines reside… Fight your way through, level after level in this idle battle RPG adult game, where carefully timed attacks can turn the tide of battle in your favor.

Do you think you can handle the madness?

STORY
Once upon a time, not long ago… a magical land known as Wonderland suddenly appeared. A few brave heroines dared to venture deep into this mysterious new world in search of answers. They, however, were unaware just how much this twisted world loved them… and wanted them to stay there forever!
Follow 12 unique heroines, each with little memory of their mysterious pasts, as they make their way through this distorted universe, and investigate Wonderland, a strange place where reality and fantasy intertwine and normal people lose their minds!
Will you bring back painful memories best forgotten and save the Alices from this insane world, or will you succumb to the madness?
Their fate is in your hands!

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Tavern of Sins
boardgame.description:
Summary of Game

Tavern of Sins is a casual merge game like no other. Run your own fantasy tavern and get ready to earn a lot of money. Come to play the #1 lewd game on your phone!

To create the hottest tavern, hire the sexiest girls! As you get more resources you will be able to hire sexier girls and unlock their private photos and animations.

Lots of different characters. Girls of many races, some exclusive ones are waiting for you to show their secrets.

Merge your girls to unlock new ones and take more money from your clients.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Coin Curling
boardgame.description:
Coin Curling is a board game for people who like sports. It is a fast-moving tabletop game of skill, dramatic comebacks, and good-natured competition.

Coin Curling is easy to learn. First - spin the coin. Second - while the coin is still spinning, tap the coin one time toward the center. Third - the team with their coin closest to the center scores.

After all 8 coins have been played, the "end" is over, and the team with the coin closest to the center scores. They get 1 point for every coin that is closer that the other team's closest coin, and the other team gets 0 points. A recreational game goes to 5 ends and can be played in as little as 20 minutes.

If you can spin a coin, you can play Coin Curling. Coin Curling is great for adults, but it is also fun for the whole family ages 8 and up. You can play individual 1-on-1, and a full team game is 2-on-2.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Recon Scout
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A new class for White Lies. Recruited from the ranks of hunters, trackers, scouts, survivalists, and Special Forces commandos, the Recon Scout is the go-to agent for missions which take a team into the outdoors. They excel in tracking, hunting, and survival in any climate and they never get lost. Entrust a Recon Scout with keeping watch or scouting ahead to avoid unpleasant surprises.

boardgame.name: Telepath
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A new class for White Lies. Sometimes people exhibit powers that surpass those of common man. These powers, if known to the general public, would frighten people, defy certain scientific and religious doctrines, and cause panic. When Bureau 19 learns of such an individual, they are approached with caution and a simple singular choice is offered: recruitment or liquidation.

boardgame.name: Agency Wristwatch
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Spies need gadgets. In the Equipment chapter of the White Lies core rulebook there are general guidelines for gadgets, and there are specific lists of gadget-like upgrades available for weapons and vehicles. This [base item] plus [upgrades] formula common to vehicles and weapons can be extended to a new type of equipment described in this supplement: the Agency Wristwatch.

An agency wristwatch costs quite a bit of money. Some agencies may provide this for free, as part of the initial outfitting of a new agent. Other agencies may require the agent to come up with the funds himself after being successful in missions. After all, fresh recruits often have a high mortality rate and it would be expensive for them to waste such gear on untested rookies.

Although sixteen individual upgrades exist in this supplement - feel free to create your own! Share in the comments!

boardgame.name: A Little Murder
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

When the heroes are invited to a fancy dinner party, they bare witness to a sinister murder. Identified as potential suspects, they must solve the mystery, track down the killer and link the incident to the strange happenings about town, all before they are charged with the crime.

A Little Murder is a beginner or intermediate adventure supplement for Age of Ambition. It features a murder mystery scenario, and is designed to run between two and four gaming sessions.

boardgame.name: The Red Dragon Inn 8: Pub Crawl
boardgame.description:
A new standalone expansion to the award-winning series! Our illustrious heroes have spent many an hour (and many a coin!) at Greyport's legendary tavern, the Red Dragon Inn. But even the most loyal customers want a change in scenery once in a while...So what do our heroes do when the same four tavern walls are getting a little dull? Pub crawl!

The Red Dragon Inn 8 introduces five new characters—the proprietors of five brand new taverns, plus a new play variant where players can travel around to multiple taverns rather than staying at the Red Dragon Inn.

-- description from the Kickstarter

The Red Dragon Inn characters bar hop to other taverns and inns of the town (The Black Dragon Depths, The Harmonious Cup, Lucky's Rolling Barrel, The Scurvy Dog, Startusk's), discovering new drinks and characters (the tavern owners: Father Farai, Lucky the Scofflaw, Nerodia the Petrifier, Phyll Startusk, Samantha the Bookie). Each pub adds its own twist to the rules. Whenever a player reveals a Drink that includes one or more Chasers, the party pawn moves to a different open tavern after the Drink and any other pending effects are finished. Each tavern has an event that is triggered as the party arrives there. It also has its own Drink deck, and once that is exhausted, the tavern closes. The party crawls back to the Red Dragon Inn only once all other taverns have closed.

boardgame.name: Monstrosity, The Card Game
boardgame.description:
In Monstrosity, The Card Game players are contestants in a reanimation competition hosted by the fictional monster building conference MONCON. The goal of the game is to collect body parts, assemble a unique monster, and harness a power source to bring it to life...think Frankenstein, but DIY. Players choose a unique heart card at the beginning of the game to guide their strategy and must assemble a monster that is compatible with the heart they chose. Every heart has unique requirements which heavily affect's the players build strategy. Throughout the game, players take turns assembling body parts, upgrading parts, sabotaging their opponents, and using action cards to stir things up. The player who is able to reanimate their monster, and score the most points, wins the game.

Monstrosity the card game can be played in a competitive free-for-all or as a 2v2.

-description from publisher
